title: Wargrave Walks

images.title: Church Street in Wargrave by Steve Daniels, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Church Street in Wargrave

images.title: Graham Horn / Wargrave Marina
images.caption: Wargrave Marina. On the south bank of the river close up to Shiplake railway bridge. Accessible by road from Waterman's Way off Station Road.

images.title: Andrew Smith / Grassland and woodland above Wargrave
images.caption: Grassland and woodland above Wargrave. A small uncultivated field stands beside Bottom Boles Wood on the shallow western slopes of Bowsey Hill.

images.title: Rosalind Mitchell / Bowsey Hill
images.caption: Bowsey Hill. An intersection of routes in beech woods high in the Chilterns.

images.title: don cload / Ways to go on Bowsey Hill
images.caption: Ways to go on Bowsey Hill. Plenty of choice on foot, bike or horse!

images.title: Andrew Smith / Pasture, Crazies Hill
images.caption: Pasture, Crazies Hill. Longhorn cattle graze with Worleys Farm in the background.

images.title: Andrew Smith / Highland cattle near Cockpole Green
images.caption: Highland cattle near Cockpole Green. Beside the footpath between Cockpole Green and Hatchgate House. Bowsey Hill is in the background to the right.

images.title: Shaun Ferguson / Gates to Cayton Park
images.caption: Gates to Cayton Park

description: This Berkshire village is located in a nice spot next to the River Thames with some lovely surrounding Chilterns countryside. The historic settlement includes many old listed buildings, a picturesque marina, a 12th century church and a very fine riverside pub for post walk refreshment. This circular walk from the village visits the woodland around Bowsey Hill before heading to Cockpole Green and Crazies Hill. There's some pleasant woodland and grassland with views of the surrounding countryside to enjoy on the way. On Bowsey Hill there are a number of different routes to choose from with walkers, horse riders and cyclists well catered for. This includes the Chiltern Way and the Knowl Hill Bridleway Circuit.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: On the High Street there's the St George & Dragon. The stylish pub serves good quality dishes which you can enjoy in the courtyard or garden. It's located in a lovely spot close to the river with fine views from the pub.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The woodland and country trails make for a fine dog walk. The George mentioned above is also dog friendly.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: If you head to the opposite side of the river you can pick up the Thames Path at nearby Shiplake. For more walking ideas in the area see the Berkshire Walks page.

display_address: School Lane, Sheeplands Farm, Wargrave, Wokingham, England, RG10 8DX, United Kingdom
